reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were in Venice for a week for performances, and decided to cap off the trip with 2 days in Lido to celebrate our anniversary. We were quite pleased with this hotel -- for starters, the staff was very friendly and helpful, especially at the front desk and breakfast room. We loved the rooftop terrace and our room came with its own private balcony as well. Those on here who complained about the smallness of the bathrooms (in general) probably have never been to Europe before. We loved the quiet area which was so close to downtown Lido, and really enjoyed strolling the streets, The concierge even recommended a restaurant for us and booked the cab as well, which was great. The breakfasts were really nice and the eating room quite pleasant. We were totally satisfied with out stay and would definitely come back.
reviews.title: A great choice in Lido

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed in Villa delle Palme last week-end, and must say that I was somewhat disappointed...I was very confident when I made the reservation, because of the various good reviews I read here, however there are two aspects of Villa delle Palme I did not enjoy.
reviews.title: "Not as good as expected"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First let me say that it is truw that the hotel is located in a quiet place, near to the Vaporetto stop, the room we had was indeed clean, and the size was ok. One thing which was not specified in the bookng was that the "standard" double room we booked was not "standard", since it had a bathroom for people with special needs, which made it less confortable for us to use...I asked for a room change but it was obviously impossible, because the hotel was fully booked, so the receptionist told us. The breakfast is another negative point: we arrived at 9.40, serving stopped at 10.30 on Sunday, when we got there (we weren't the last guests), the bread had finished, there 2 slices left of salami and cheese for the savoury things, and only a couple of croissants. We asked the only person who was doing the breakfast service for some bread, she first said she was sorry but they didn't have any anymore. When we clearly showed big disappointment and surprise (well maybe indignation), she asked for a few minutes, after that she came back with 4 small panini, which had gone from freezer to oven. In the meantime another couple of guests had arrived, and decided to recycle coffee, tea, and even a croissant leftover from other tables, since noone was there to attend them! They definitely need more people to work there, and more food for breakfast, where the overall choice was rather limited. Considering the prices in Venice, what we paid (80€ for 1 night) was still ok, but I was disappointed...and think the ranking here is way too high!
reviews.title: Don’t bother – try somewhere else!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked here for a long weekend for my girlfriends birthday. They seemed very helpful to upgrade us to the best room available when explained it was a special occasion.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but small rooms/bathrooms
Expensive LIES!
reviews.text: However, for the amount we spent (145 Euro a night) the hotel and service was a huge disappointment. We saw some feedback from others that it was quite noisy from other rooms and staff, especially on the ground floor, so we specifically asked for a 1st floor room – this doesn’t make a difference by the way –their website says soundproof walls – that is definitely not the case - so if you enjoy listening to other peoples conversations and them going to the toilet then this is the hotel for you!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights at the Villa Delle Palme in 12/06. The room was fantastic (loved the Venetian textile 'wallpaper') and the service was excellent. Breakfast was nothing to write home about (cold buffet) but adequate nevertheless. The hotel is only a 5 min walk to the Valparetto, which takes around 15 mins to St Marks Square. The weather in December made the journey quite arduous at times but I would imagine its a rather nicer experience during summer.
reviews.title: Absolutely loved it

likes.liked: — Hotel with character, size of the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a excellent value for money if you don`t mind staying a short boat ride away from the main island...
reviews.title: Top marks for Villa Delle Palme

likes.disliked: — Shower cubicle is a little small

reviews.text: Totally enjoyable stay at this lovely hotel. Very convenient situation for Vaporetto piers. Arrived really late by boat from airport and had no trouble finding hotel - 5 mins. walk. Everything very clean, beds comfortable, shower worked fine, no complaints at all. Breakfast was good and everything fresh and well presented. Special compliments to the young lady who serves tea/coffee - very friendly and helpful. All hotel staff very pleasant. No hesitation in recommending Villa Delle Plame.
reviews.title: Best accommodation of the Big 3

likes.liked: — Friendly service, convience to transportation, extras included
likes.disliked: — Very expensive and slow Internet connection -- go elsewhere

reviews.title: Good for budget!
reviews.text: However, if you go out for a meal on Lido I suggest you avoid Ristorante Alla Botte, Gran Viale, unless you want a very disappointing dining experience!!

We travelled to the Big 3: Rome, Venice, Florence, plus a small town in central Italy. Interestingly, we paid the same price at each location: 85 Euros per night. Only in Venice and in the small town did we receive both a private bath and an included breakfast for that price. VIlla Della Palme wins the contest though, as service was thorough and friendly, and the hotel is away from the throngs of tourists (this would not be the case in summer, though!)
reviews.title: Can't get a better place to stay in Venice for these rates....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a superb hotel, just a short vaperetto ride from the Grand Canal.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived in Venice by train. As you descend the steps from the train station, you realise you have arrive somewhere very special. Ahead of you is the Grand Canal with its beautiful palaces and boats.
reviews.title: Spotless and elegant
A very pleasant time
reviews.text: We got the vaperetto to the Lido, takes about 20 mins and then the hotel is 2 minutes from the vaparetto stop on the Lido.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We received a very warm welcome at the hotel and were shown straight up to our room. The room was quite small, but had a lovely terrace with sun loungers and table, which was a lovely surprise. We also had a bottle of Prosecco chilling, with the managers compliments.
reviews.title: Wonderful- don't stay anywhere else!

reviews.text: The bathroom was absolutely fine, but the shower cubical was quite small!!
reviews.title: Good base for a family visit to Venice

likes.liked: — Good sized family room. Convenient for getting into Venice and to the beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for a week with my fiance for my birthday. The location was great, on the Lido which is quieter then Venice proper. The hotel itself was quite small, we stayed in the disabled room (I think it was the last one left) which was huge, especially the bathroom. The staff were helpful and the breakfast was lovely.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was a little noisey but this did not really bother us as we are heavy sleepers and we have been advised most hotels in Venice have a little noise.
reviews.title: Nice reception...not clean enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mostly a lovely stay, within 5 mins of Venice centre.
reviews.title: A great place to stay

likes.liked: — Rooms are well appointed, great location, quiet, well managed, good facilities and setting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a small 3 stars hotel in Lido. For location, it is not far...only walk 5 mins to the pier and 10 mins to St. Mark. It is a quite place and easy to find. Our room is on the ground floor. The decoration is new and overall tidy. We've been to different cities in Italy which is the most nice person in reception. Other staff is also nice. The place for breakfast is classic euorpean style. We like it.
reviews.title: Loved Villa delle Palme

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the disadvantages, we think it is not clean enough. We found pieces of sand and dust in the bed sheet. Also, the staff is not careful enough. We found a glasses in the room which may belong to the previous guests, I guess. We feel a bit strength becoz the room is facilited for disabled. Overall rating should be slightly better than average. In Venice, the rate is acceptable.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel!
